intro: Agathosma gracillima, commonly known as the slender agathosma, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Western Cape of South Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants. Agathosma gracillima is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental appeal.
